docs.lead_paragraph: Some poor and middle-income countries with relatively healthy diets are being targeted by Western food companies with increased advertising.

headline.main: Food Habits Getting Worse Around the World
headline.print_headline: Food Habits Becoming Worse Around the World

docs.abstract: Series of studies in journals The Lancet and Lancet Global Health points to worsening diet and increased obesity around world, particularly in countries with rising incomes; trends are occurring in tandem with increase of advertising targeting children by Western junk food and snack manufacturers.
docs.snippet: Some poor and middle-income countries with relatively healthy diets are being targeted by Western food companies with increased advertising.

docs.lead_paragraph: Government recommendations on how much fat and salt you should eat weren’t always based on the best available evidence. That may be changing.

headline.main: Behind New Dietary Guidelines, Better Science

docs.snippet: Government recommendations on how much fat and salt you should eat weren’t always based on the best available evidence. That may be changing.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dole Food Co owner David Murdock began a trial on Monday defending his 2013 buyout of the world's largest fruit and vegetable producer with often unfocused testimony about his unusual memory, passion for nutrition and dislike of people talking about his age.

headline.main: Dole Owner Murdock Rambles in Testimony About Company Buyout
headline.print_headline: Dole Owner Murdock Rambles in Testimony About Company Buyout

docs.lead_paragraph: The world's diet has deteriorated substantially in the last two decades, a leading nutrition expert said on Monday, citing one of the largest studies available on international eating habits.

headline.main: World's Diet Worsening With Globalisation, Major Study Finds
headline.print_headline: World's Diet Worsening With Globalisation, Major Study Finds

docs.snippet: The world's diet has deteriorated substantially in the last two decades, a leading nutrition expert said on Monday, citing one of the largest studies available on international eating habits.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama’s veto of the pipeline bill this week, the third and most significant one of his six years in office, would most likely be followed by others.

headline.main: Obama’s Expected Keystone Pipeline Veto Is Likely to Be the First in a Wave
headline.print_headline: Oil Pipeline Veto Expected to Be First in a Wave

docs.abstract: Pres Obama enters period in which he is expected to robustly exercise his veto power to combat Republican Congressional majority, beginning with bill that would force construction of Keystone XL oil pipeline; has so far only used veto twice, but will likely use it in coming months on bills that would change Affordable Care Act, impose new sanctions on Iran and roll back child nutritional standards.
docs.snippet: President Obama’s veto of the pipeline bill this week, the third and most significant one of his six years in office, would most likely be followed by others.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and CORAL DAVENPORT

docs.lead_paragraph: In addition to providing the more typical personal chef service, several businesses in the Westchester area also offer in-home cooking lessons and parties.

headline.seo: In Westchester, Offering Cooking Lessons at Home
headline.main: The Dinner Party as Teachable Moment
headline.print_headline: The Dinner Party as Teachable Moment

docs.abstract: Handful of businesses in Westchester, NY, offer in-home cooking lessons and in-home cooking parties, as well as more typical private chef services (Metropolitan/Westchester).
docs.snippet: In addition to providing the more typical personal chef service, several businesses in the Westchester area also offer in-home cooking lessons and parties.
